summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Material Handler at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on September 30, 2019. The witness provides a detailed account of his activities and observations during his shift on August 9, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died, including the distribution of commissary and food, and interactions with other officers in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Omer Ramey
persons.role: Material Handler, Bureau of Prisons (BOP) at Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
persons.context: The primary witness being interviewed. He worked his normal 8am-4pm shift and overtime in the SHU on August 9, 2019, and describes his activities delivering commissary and food, including to Epstein's cell.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: An officer working in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with the witness on August 9, 2019. The witness helped NOEL with the food feed and states NOEL would have had to be at the grill for him to go down range.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate in the SHU. The witness delivered food to his cell on L-Tier and mentions possibly waving to him.

connections.description: Worked together in the MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 9, 2019. Ramey helped NOEL with the food feed and commissary distribution.
Ramey, as a Material Handler, delivered food to inmate Epstein's cell on L-Tier on the night of August 9, 2019.

events.title: Witness's Shift and Activities at MCC
events.description: Omer Ramey worked his normal 8am-4pm shift in the warehouse and commissary, then overtime in the SHU starting around 4:15pm. He helped with food feed and commissary distribution, including to Epstein's cell on L-Tier.

events.title: FBI Interview of Material Handler
events.description: Omer Ramey was interviewed by the FBI, OIG, and AUSA at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York regarding his activities and observations on August 9, 2019, at MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The witness, Omer Ramey, was in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) during overtime on the evening of August 9, 2019, and delivered food to Jeffrey Epstein's cell on L-Tier.
Ramey stated he spent no more than 60 seconds at Epstein's cell when delivering food and did not recall being told Epstein was a priority to check on that night.
Ramey indicated it was against MCC policy for an officer to go down the tiers alone without another officer assisting, and he didn't know if another officer would have taken that risk.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement, indicating the witness was providing information potentially in exchange for some form of consideration or immunity.
